page.title: 06A FAMILY DAY IN GILLINGHAM
page.content: Home life is most important at weekends,when members of the family see more of each other.Most families have three meals a day.Mealtimes are usually later at the weekends.Many children have breakfast by themselves, and usually the whole family are together only for the main meal of the day.Sometimes children go shopping with their mothers,but otherwise spend much of the day playing with their friends or watching television.Many families have more than one television set,and most children watch during the day and before going to bed.Most families do not see a lot of their relatives:usually one visit a week is made by a close relative,often for afternoon tea.Most children say they enjoy their home life.
